Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 06 Apr 2019If you have your emergency funds and insurance set up nicely, you can look at ETFs or Robo Advisors. Both will be able to provide global diversification and decent returns. ETFs will be lower in fees but you have to do your own research to see which ETFs suits you and for robo advisors, they will do a lot of the work for u but a slightly higher fees.0 comments0
